guidance: Discard. TED translates at form-level. OCDS translates at field-level.

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'buyer' to its `.roles`\n\nSet `buyer.id` to its `.id`, and set `buyer.name` to its [`.name`](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME)
Map to the party's `.identifier.id`, and set `.identifier.scheme`

Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the party's `.address.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)

Take the country code in the `VALUE` attribute, translate to a country name, and map to the party's `.address.countryName`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#524](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/524)) to add a `.countryCode` field to the `Address` object, to avoid translation. (ISSUE)
Set `tender.classification.scheme` to 'CPV', take the CPV code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to `tender.classification.id` (PROPOSAL #15)

For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id` (PROPOSAL #16)

Add a `Lot` object to the `tender.lots` array, and add an `Item` object to the `tender.items` array. Set the lot's `.status` to the same value as `tender.status`.\n\n**F12, F13**: Set the lot's `.id` to '1', and set the item's `.id` to '1'.
Map to the lot's `.title`, and map to the item's `.title` (PROPOSAL #29)
If not set, let *Lot No* be '1'. Map to the lot's `.id`, map to the item's `.id`, and map to the item's `.relatedLot`.
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPV', and map to its `.id`.
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id`.

Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the item's `.deliveryAddress.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)
Map to the lot's `.description`, and map to the item's `.description`

Get the `Organization` object for the European Union; if none exists yet, [add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and set its `.name` to 'European Union'. Then, add 'funder' to its `.roles`.

Get the `Finance` object for this project; if none exists yet, add a `Finance` object to the `planning.budget.finance` array, map to its `.description`, set its `.id`, set its `.financingParty.name` to 'European Union', and set its `.financingParty.id` to the party's `.id`. Then, add the lot's `.id` to its `.relatedLots`. (PROPOSAL #20)

In [future forms](https://github.com/eForms/eForms/issues/181#issuecomment-439861320), this field will be de-emphasized.
Discard. If there's no party with the role 'funder' and the name 'European Union', then the procurement isn't related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds.
Discard. The *contract award notice concerning this contract* is the OCDS release with the same `ocid` as this release, with 'award' in its `tag`, and with the nearest earlier `date` to this release.
Add an `Award` object to the `awards` array
If not set, let *Lot No* be '1'. Add to the award's `.relatedLots`.

Set the award's `.status` to 'active'\n\nAdd a `Contract` object to the `contracts` array, set its `.id` and `.awardID` to the award's `.id`, set its `.title` to the award's `.title`, and set its `.status` to 'active'.

comment: This element contains elements from V.2.2 and V.2.3.

guidance: Discard. If there are multiple suppliers, then the contract has been awarded to a group of economic operators.
Discard. If there is one supplier, then the contract hasn't been awarded to a group of economic operators.

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'supplier' to its `.roles`\n\nAdd an `OrganizationReference` object to the award's `.suppliers` array, set its `.id` to the party's `.id`, and set its `.name` to the party's [`.name`](#/AWARD_CONTRACT/AWARDED_CONTRACT/CONTRACTORS/CONTRACTOR/ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR/OFFICIALNAME)

Discard. The *information on value of the contract/lot/concession (at the time of conclusion of the contract)* is available in the OCDS release with the same `ocid` as this release, with 'award' in its `tag`, and with the nearest earlier `date` to this release.
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'reviewBody' to its `.roles`
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'mediationBody' to its `.roles` (PROPOSAL #4)
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'reviewContactPoint' to its `.roles` (PROPOSAL #25)
Copy the `Item` object in `tender.items` to `.items` on the `Contract` object in `contracts`, and delete the contract's item's `.classification` and `.additionalClassifications`.
Set the item's `.classification.scheme` to 'CPV', take the CPV code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the item's `.classification.id`
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id`
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPV', and map to its `.id`.
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id`.

Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the item's `.deliveryAddress.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)
Discard. If there are multiple suppliers, then the contract has been awarded to a group of economic operators.
Discard. If there is one supplier, then the contract hasn't been awarded to a group of economic operators.

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'supplier' to its `.roles`

Add an `OrganizationReference` object to the award's `.suppliers` array, set its `.id` to the party's `.id`, and set its `.name` to the party's `.name`.

There's an open issue ([#232](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/232)) relevant to removing previous entries from the `parties` and `.suppliers` arrays. (ISSUE)
Add an `Amendment` object to the contract's `.amendments` array, and set its `.id`.
Prefix by the [translation](../operations#get-a-translation) of "Need for additional works, services or supplies by the original contractor/concessionaire: ", and map to the amendment's `.rationale`

Prefix by the [translation](../operations#get-a-translation) of "Need for modification brought about by circumstances which a diligent contracting authority/entity could not foresee: ", and map to the amendment's `.rationale`

Discard. The *updated total contract value before the modifications* is available in the OCDS release with the same `ocid` as this release, with 'contract' or 'contractUpdate' in its `tag`, and with the nearest earlier `date` to this release.
